meanings.sent1: The bully tried to delegitimize my win by saying I cheated.
meanings.sent2: The fake ID was used to delegitimize his age at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to delegitimize the dog's claim to the sunny spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds delegitimized the fragile tent, blowing it away.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick delegitimized the audience's belief in reality.

meanings.definition: To undermine or discredit the legitimacy or authority of.
meanings.sent1: The false rumors were spread to delegitimize the politician's campaign.
meanings.sent2: The hacker's goal was to delegitimize the company's online security measures.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to delegitimize the bird's claim to the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The loud protests delegitimized the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist delegitimized the audience's trust in the main character.
